ptm.name: carboxylated residue
ptm.description: A protein modification that effectively replaces a hydrogen atom with a carboxylic acid group.

ptm.name: phosphorylated residue with neutral loss of phosphate
ptm.description: Covalent modification of, or a change resulting in an alteration of the measured molecular mass of, a peptide or protein amino acid phosphorylated residue with a secondary loss of a neutral trihydrogen phosphate molecular fragment.

ptm.name: pyruvic acid
ptm.description: A protein modification that effectively converts a source amino acid to pyruvic acid.

ptm.name: methylthiolated residue
ptm.description: A protein modification that effectively replaces a hydrogen atom with an methylsulfanyl group (thiomethyl group).

ptm.name: protein modification categorized by chemical process
ptm.description: Modified amino acid residue derived from a natural amino acid by a real or hypothetical chemical process.

ptm.name: lipoconjugated residue
ptm.description: A protein modification that effectively results from forming an adduct with a compound containing a lipid-like group either through acylation, alkylation, or amidation.

ptm.name: modified L-selenocysteine residue
ptm.description: A protein modification that modifies an L-selenocysteine residue.

ptm.name: protein modification categorized by amino acid modified
ptm.description: A protein modification considered either as modified amino acid residues derived from natural amino acids, as a replacement by another natural amino acid, or as a replacement by an unnatural amino acid.

ptm.name: peptidoglycanated residue
ptm.description: A protein modification that effectively attaches a residue to murein peptidoglycan by either a pentaglycine linker peptide or a peptide-like L-alanyl-D-glutamyl-2,6-diaminopimelic acid linkage.

ptm.name: deoxygenated residue
ptm.description: A protein modification that effectively removes oxygen atoms from a residue without the removal of hydrogen atoms.

ptm.name: deaminated residue
ptm.description: A protein modification that effectively results in the loss of an ammonia, usually by a process of vicinal dehydration, rearrangement, and rehydration with release of ammonia, resulting in a loss of nitrogen with no gain of oxygen.

ptm.name: guanylated residue
ptm.description: A protein modification that effectively crosslinks an amino acid residue and 5'-phosphoguanosine through either a phosphodiester or a phosphoramide bond.
